tg.t: To mean continuous action. Means always or keeps doing.
it catches in the corners so as to be blocked or stuck
A story is told about him.
s/he tells about s.o., s/he talks about s.o.; s/he narrates about s.o.
They are telling a story about him or them.
All of you tell a story.
He tells a story for him or them.
A story is told for him.
They are telling each other stories.
s/he tells a story to s.o., s/he tells news to s.o.; s/he tells s.o. about (it/him), s/he gives s.o. an account
They are telling stories to them.
All of you, tell him a story.
All of you tell me a story.
s/he tells, s/he tells a story; s/he tells news, s/he gives an account, s/he narrates; s/he tells his/her own story
story, true story, account, report; news; what is being told
He shrinks or decreases it with his hands.
s/he makes s.t. less; s/he lessens s.t.
Means there is a change in thought or action, because something was done on purpose; E.g. Ahcana (A subtle message to mean or you will be sorry).
Used as a singular word to complete some event that is going to happen.
Used as a prefix to mean a change in time, movement or place.
1. Means he did not want to camp overnight, but he had to for some reason.
2. He changed where to camp overnight.
In spite of. Despite of; also nevertheless.
He is moved to a different location or position.
He moves him to a different location or position.
s/he moves s.o. over by pulling
s/he puts s.o. (s.w.), s/he places s.o.; s/he sets s.o. down
All of you put him there. [Command]
All of you place me there. [Command]
You place me or put me there. [Command]
Keep on thinking of what has to be done.
s/he continues to think of future deeds or tasks
He keeps on thinking of what has to be done.
s/he continues to think of future deeds or tasks
All of you persevere or try hard. [Command]
s/he gives s.o. a sharp pain, s/he gives s.o. a great deal of pain; s/he hurts s.o.
it has a strong, sharp, or bitter taste
It is a bitter, strong liquid.
it is a strong, sharp, or bitter liquid
it is painful; it is tart
it is freezing, it is frozen, it is frozen hard
He is insistent, persistent. He has to get what he wants.
Or, either, or else sometimes used with - apho etikwe - means maybe. Also ahpohetikwe.
s/he puts s.o. elsewhere, s/he places s.o. elsewhere
He places it at a different place.
He changes the dates or events to a different time and place.
s/he moves s.t.'s place; s/he puts s.t. elsewhere, s/he places s.t. elsewhere
It is at a different place. 2. Means that dates and/or events have been changed to a different time or place.
Ouch! Said when one hurts himself or gets hurt.
He makes a net out of it.
He gossips about someone or them.
He revives after a coma or surgery.
overseas, across the ocean; in the land across the water
across, on the far side; across (water or land)
Across a small body of water.
across, on the far side; across (water or land)
s/he shades s.t. with his/her own shadow
All of your shade it by standing near it. [Command]
He is shaded by another person's shadow.
s/he shades s.o. with his/her own shadow
s/he counts s.t.; s/he adds s.t.
Those things are counted for him.
in succession, one after the other; collectively
s/he hangs things (e.g. clothes) up, s/he hangs clothes on a clothesline
s/he hangs, s/he is hanging, s/he is suspended
s/he shields s.t.; s/he covers s.t.
An object floats in the water.
it soaks, it is in water
He soaks it (dunks it) in the water.
s/he soaks s.t. in water, s/he puts s.t. into water
A curtain or a makeshift covering.
He is covering something usually means curtains or a window.
The grass is wet with dew.
Further, farther. At or to a greater distance or degree.
quite a lot; well on its way, a long ways, more than halfway
Take it out of the liquid.
He fishes it out of the liquid.
He pins it to the wall.
it is mouldy; it is rusty
It went moldy by sitting there too long.
Take it out of the liquid. [Command]
An outer cloth covering for a baby's head. A baby's veil, for a moss bag.
He takes it out of the liquid.
s/he takes s.t. from water or fire by hand; s/he lifts s.t. out of the water or off the stove
He is taken out of the (fire or water) liquid.
He takes him out of the water
s/he takes s.o. from water or fire by hand; s/he lifts s.o. out of the water or off the stove
He burns by touching a hot stove (or a hot metal).
s/he pulls s.t. from the water; s/he drags s.t. out of the water
He pulls him out of the fire or water.
s/he pulls s.o. from the water; s/he drags s.t. out of the water
Necessarily. It is necessary. Something that's positively needed.
really, rather; overanxious; [in negative clauses:] not really, not as much
He rises up (i.e., with the help of something).
The act of climbing up. May also mean stairs of any kind.
When said, to show pity or concern.
s/he puts a new floor down (on s.t.)
The floor is covered for him. Or there is a special place on the floor covered, just for him.
He covers the floor for him.
They are laying a covering on the floor for them.
A covering for the floor. Could be a quilt or a rug.
mat, matting; floor, floor covering, carpet; sheet; quilt
mattress pad; cushion, potholder; an item placed under oneself or a hot pot
s/he places a mat for him/herself; s/he lies on s.t., s/he has s.t. under him/her
Means a joking, lengthening or more of something.
He lengthens it by tying two ropes together.
s/he ties s.t. end to end, s/he lengthens s.t. (i.e. by tying on an extra length)
s/he lengthens s.t.; s/he joins s.t.
great great grandparent, great great grandchild
Recently, now. In this modern day and age.
He denies it. Also, disbelieves, refuses it.
s/he doubts s.t., s/he rejects s.t., s/he denies s.t., s/he disbelieves s.t.
s/he rejects s.o., s/he denies s.o., s/he disbelieves s.o.
He is denied, disbelieved, or refused.
He denies, disbelieves or refuses him.
s/he rejects s.o., s/he denies s.o., s/he disbelieves s.o.
